The other Thai restaurant I really enjoyed was a good 4-5 miles from the strip in a suburban strip mall, and probably a bit too far from the strip to venture out to, unless you have a car and GPS. This place is convenient.
I used to work close to here and their lunch specials are amazing. So is their chicken pad Thai. I never would have gone here if a coworker hadn't told me about it.

Ive been eating at Kung Fu for years. Anyone Ive ever taken there or ordered with loves it. They deliver! I have not found crab rangoon anywhere that compares to theirs. You order the spice of a dish on a hotness level 1-10. They could be a little more consistent with that but I think it depends on the cook. I dont like too hot so I order a 1 or 2 which sometimes can feel more like a 4 or 5.. but overall, the best Chinese & Thai cuisine.

Since I discovered the restaurant (2 years now)  I ate there or ordered to-go at least once a week. Most of the guys basically know me by my name already. 

If you like soups, you should try the Tom-Yum Soup, though I never go higher than number 3-4, I guess at 8 it should be really spicy!

For delivery, our whole office loves the Mongolian Beef or Chicken, and also the Chopped Chicken Ya Kee Mao is one of my fav's.

The prices are really good, their lunch special comes for $6.50 with one egg roll and one chicken piece.

I would recommend it to most of Thai lovers...
Good menu. Fair service. Fair prices Casual  full bar   Something for everyone   can't complain

horrible experience. We ordered our food online 2 hours ago and still NO FOOD. we just called and they clearly have no idea that we even ordered, we've talked to 3 different people in the past hour about our food. The last time we called she offered to retake our order and start from scratch. Meanwhile, the credit card was charged for food we never received. The lady took our number and said the "computer is broken" and the boss will call me back later for a refund. Worst experience i've had with lunch. My lunch hour is now :(
Best thai food in town. Almost as good as moms cooking! Food is fast but sometimes appetizers come after main course, that's why only 4 stars.excuse the half eaten plates...

The food here is mediocre, but it is pretty cheap. 

I've gone here about three times and from what I can remember I've had pad thai, tom yum soup, chow mein, a chicken dish, a duck dish, and a beef dish. All of the dishes were satisfactory, nothing more. 

The staff isn't very friendly. I have never being greeted here, or given a nice goodbye. 

It's a nice place to go if you want a lot of food for a low price and aren't too concerned about service.

*You can also view the comment that was left on this review to get a further understanding of the people that work there:

-Only I would know how many times I've gone to this restaurant, so for this person to say, " I'm sure you've been here more, you just forgot a few other times we were together," is just a little absurd. And after asking my boyfriend, it turns out I've only gone here TWO times.   

-"You'll probably have to get use to having great tasting Thai and Chinese food." Excuse me? I'll probably have to GET USE TO having this stuff? As if I haven't gone to other Thai and Chinese restaurants before. I didn't even mention the fact that it was Chinese and Thai in my review, so i don't see what that has to do with anything. 

-"see for yourself. The Tourism Authority of Thailand delegates to the DEMA show dined with us three out of the four days they were here in Vegas." Umm, is that suppose to mean something to me? Showing me some link isn't going to change my taste buds. 


I gave this restaurant two stars for a reason. The food is mediocre and the service is lacking, but that doesn't mean I hated it.  I've left far worse reviews at other places.
Fast delivery and great food!   If you try nothing else get the crispy pork,  beef jerky and the fried shrimp!   Delish!

I have been here since I was a kid. The thai food is F A B U L O U S! The only problem is that they really should waive the extra rice fee of $2.50 if you have four or more people. But other than that, this is the BEST thai food in Las Vegas and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants to try something new or any good thai restaurant.

This review is long overdue, but I really need to give this restaurant a superb rating, because it without a doubt was delicious.

I went to Las Vegas for the summer and ate at a restaurant every day for a week, but Kung Fu Thai and Chinese Restaurant was definitely my favorite. My uncle kept saying that Thai food is good, but I've never tried it and pushed to eat at other restaurants.

On our last night there, we tried this place. I was just FLOORED by how scrumptious each and everyone one of my bites of food were. The waiters provided EXCELLENT service and they were so kind! We went at night, so it was just our huge family of around 30 and another small family at a table near us.

Foods I ate:
-Tom Yum soup
-Seasoned fish (forgot what it was called, but I hate fish and this was one of the only times I enjoyed eating it!)
-MONGOLIAN BEEF *YES YES YES*

I forgot all of the other dishes, but I'm sure that they all had just the right seasoning, texture, and taste.

Definitely give this place a try if you're ever in the area!

TREATED SO BADLY AFTER BEING A LOYAL CUSTOMER FOR 5 YEARS!!!! I have been ordering delivery from this place for 5 years, I called tonight to place an order and the lady on the phone rudely told me we don't deliver to you anymore! I tried to explain to her that they have delivered to me 2-3 a month for the last 5 years, she now starting yelling at me and said I told you 20 times we do not deliver there and hung up on me. I work In a casino/hotel on the strip and have always recommended them to guests and also ordered huge orders for my department! They charge for delivery but have always tipped 20-25 percent. I am so disappointed in this establishment of how they treated me and I will pass it on to everyone I know! TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! You lost a great customer! Zero stars for you Kung Fu, you should be ashamed of your behavior!!!!!!!!!

Must have passed this place a million and one times over the last ten years since I came to town and never stopped in. Heard good things about it and fellow colleagues always go, so today me and Ellen F. decide to check it out. 

Located on the southwest corner in the strip mall on Valley View and Spring Mountain, can't miss it with a name like Kung Fu on the outside. We were seated right away, place wasn't too busy so a waiter took our drink orders promptly. 

The place looks old school but don't care about that, has a lot of Thai decor with elephants and pictures of the motherland. I get the feeling this place is geared more toward Thai than Chinese but who knows. If you want pad Thai don't fall for the trap and order it from the menu as they offer it as a lunch special for $6.95 Mon-Fri 11am-3pm. I fell for this and ordered the combo pad Thai with an order of rice, it was huge!! Enough for two people. 

I doubt the lunch portion is as big but still much cheaper and comes with soup or an egg roll. The pad Thai was very good, along with the rice, the quantity was more than enough and the bill was reasonable. We will be returning during lunch hours to take full advantage of the specials. If your looking for a cheap meal in Chinatown with no frills it's worth a stop.

Ok so I went with a Thai girl and had no idea what I was eating. She was kind and ordered a creamy chicken soup that was excellent. A ground beef thing over rice that was spicy but really good, Also had something that looked like beef jerky that was soft in the middle and very good. A full Chinese menu is also offered, 

Thai tea is recommended.
Delicious and timely but I ended up sick the next day! Watch out on the seafood options.

The food are very good / and service is the best how many times I come to vegus I never forget to visit them here 



The best restaurant in vegus should come try it 




Come back today again so good !!!! Lv

This place is the best Thai/Chinese food place on Valley View Rd! We went here with a group and could not believe how extensive the menu was. We each ordered a plate and shared it. There was even plenty enough to share with even more people. The service was great and attentive. They even have a bar inside. This place is open until 1am.

I have to say this is my favorite Chinese food spot in Vegas. I always order the sweet and sour shrimp with my meal and it is always fantastic. The last time I went, I went with my son. He ordered the whole fried catfish and you should of seen when the waiter sat it down in front of him. He almost jumped out his skin. 

But kids aside, ordering whole catfish when they don't know what to expect and aren't listening to the adults tell them it is a whole catfish the food is always great and the service matches it. Oh, the catfish was fantastic with the chili sauce being delightfully unique.

I love this place. You know why? The BEST service and the most friendly and attentive staff- period.  Genuine, kind individuals working here and I adore them all. Food always comes out quick, so you're never waiting a year for your food to come and never will you have an empty glass. Just doesn't happen here.

I will admit that I generically order the same 4 things (with other new dishes) every time I come to Kung Fu:

1. Mongolian Beef - NOTHING...and I mean NOTHING- tops their MB.
2. Tom Yum Soup with Tofu - I cry because San Francisco doesn't know how to make it like Vegas does. I have tried numerous Thai restaurants in SF and gave up because they all use some kind of tomato tasting broth that totally turns my taste buds off. It was heartbreaking when I moved away from LV. Kung Fu knows exactly how to make my spicy and sour broth!! (Try Komals if you want the very best Tom Yum in LV)
3. Orange Chicken - Very strong flavored orange glaze over crispy chicken. YUM!!!
4. Thai Vegetable Fried Rice with egg - love it!

While visually its not the greatest looking restaurant, don't mind that because what's looks got to do with it?!?

Service always weighs heavily on my mind when forming opinions about restaurants, business etc. that I go to, and I can't emphasize enough that the staff here just gets is right- 100% of the time...for me anyways, but maybe the just like me ;)

I have eaten here twice when I have been visiting Vegas.  Both times I've had the panang curry.  It was very good both times.  My service has always been good and I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas and looking for Thai.

The worst service ever. Waiter started arguing with me after he brought the wrong soup and told me that I got what I ordered. Then he just walked away. Then he came back telling me again that this I what I ordered, this time he took the soup and walked away telling me of in Chinese. Another waiter came to our table and recognized me from his prior restaurant and says hi and that he wanted to apologize for for his behavior. The new waiter even remembered what I use to ordered at his restaurant. He brought me my favorite soup and told me about Thor curries and that next time we come in to order the green curry, because it is the same as the one I use to order at his old restaurant. Food is mediocre and the service is horrible. Don't know if I will be back ever.

This place was recommended to me by a great friend. I am not one to choose Asian food for a meal.  I've tried different Chinese & Thai food restaurants, but I leave un satisfied and not very impressed!

Kung Ku has yet to disappointment me! The food is very flavorful and I have yet to not like something I've ordered.  

The food is served family style and the prices are reasonable!  You won't find yourself waiting long either because the food comes out fast!    If you're in the area, give it try!

Great food and good service.  The dinning room could use a little TLC. It seems cluttered and disorganized.  If your looking for good food  please give hem a chance. You will not be disappointed at the quality and quantity of food serviced here.

Amazing resturant!! Have been going here since I moved to Vegas! I love the friendly service and the amazing food. I believe that this place has the best pad see ew (pardon my spelling). I do agree that the atmosphere of the resturant is not too appealing but I really concentrate more on the delicious cuisine. Go here for authentic thai food (:
Love Kung Fu!  Such good food. I've only ordered for delivery but this is my go to spot when I didn't get around to cooking dinner. Open late for delivery.  Also big portions and fast delivery. Yum!
Saayywhaaa???!!!  I have been in Vegas all my life and am so MAD I didn't discover this one sooner.  GREAT food GREAT service.

Kung Fu Plaza Restaurant is one of the first restaurants you see as you enter Las Vegas Chinatown from the strip. I can't stand the name of the restaurant, but the food is not too shabby. A few years ago, I thought this place was the bomb, but I think because of the combination of food we ordered, I left feeling underwhelmed. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't so spectacular either. This restaurant offers both Thai and Chinese cuisine.

Gotta have Tom Yum. We ordered the seafood. For 13 bucks, they didn't give us much soup, and the seafood was sparse, but it tasted alright. 

The Pad Thai was decent. Kind of hard to mess up pad thai.

My sister ordered the Cashew Chicken. This was just an average dish. 

The Pan-fried Catfish was everyone's favorite. The fish wasn't perfectly fried by a long shot, but the sauce was very good. I'm not sure why it says that the sauce is "curry like" on the menu, but it was a bit spicy, and the basil added fragrance. I love spicy! 

Ok, let me tell you about this dish that hubby ordered. He has a history of ordering bad dishes. This was the Pa Nang Curry with Beef. It was like scooping a spoonful of peanut butter into my mouth. My mom said it was "so weird" in Vietnamese. It was.

Lots of photos and full review on my blog.

I don't live in proximity to Kung Fu but I had an appointment in the area and it was recommended to me. I was told I have to try the duck. Since I'm always game to try things that people seem to be so passionate about, I thought why not?

First I will say that the parking was a bit confusing. Kung Fu is located in a strip mall on Spring Mountain but the actual restaurant faces Decatur. You can't actually see it from the parking so you really have to know that it's there or you would totally miss it.

After looking through the pretty extensive menu we decided on the Crab Rangoon for an appetizer, the half duck and the chicken Pad Thai. Well one of my pet peeves is when the appetizer arrives the same time as the entree which is what happened here. I still can't figure out why anyone would rave about the duck. It was super rubbery and none of the fat was rendered. The Pad Thai was solid however but not enough of a reason to come back. And lastly, the service was not very attentive. We even had to wave someone down to get our check.

China Town has so many great restaurants in the area but this one is not going to be on my radar in the future unfortunately.

Not my fave.  My thing is rare beef soup and spicy, but everything  was sweet.  My moms dish, my sons dish, all things ypu would not expect.  Attentive staff and  relatively  clean.  There was a security  guard watching over the alley so parking was convenient.

One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  Been coming here for more than 15 years.  Love the duck noodles!!
Best long island ice tea in Vegas!

Very good. We had the lunch specials and a friend had the combo fried rice. Also an order of crab Rangoon for the table. My lunch special was sweet and sour chicken,  soup, fried rice and an egg roll. It was all very tasty. Nice place!

I don't really have a clear recollection of the good, but I'm guessing it was pretty good, 'cuz I didn't end up throwing any away. The service was decent enough for take-out. As Ashley said, parking is a bitch, but, hey, it's not like Kung Fu built the parking lot.

Me and my husband ate here today for their lunch specials.
Their chopped chicken with mint wasn't good and the texture was overcooked, so I called and talked to the server and asked if my husband can change it.she was gone for a minute and came back saying " we cannot change it coz he already touched the food"
We were like thats the point because the food was garbage!
This restaurant has bad service, bad food and the restaurant smelled bad too.
We are never ever coming back here

We came here after the Thai restaurant we were planning to go to didn't open for a half hour beyond their published time.  That's what's so good about living in a city where there are hundreds of choices.

I ordered the Green curry with pork--spice level 7 out of 10--and my wife got the Garlic pepper chicken.  We have to remember to tell Asian and Mexican restaurants to leave off the cilantro.  She's one of those strange creatures who doesn't like cilantro.

Both dishes were very good and the spice level of 7 was great!  Perhaps I could have pushed it higher, but this had a good zing and only a few small tears showed themselves.

We ended the meal each having a scoop of ice cream.  I had the mango and Andrea had the coconut.  Mine was very creamy and tasty and hers was, too--I finished hers.  Win- win!

Service was just wonderful.  A couple of people took our order, delivered food, brought iced tea refills.  It was a team effort.  That earned them the 4th star.

Where do i begin with this place.....i usually critique the food and the food only, despite the bad service im rating this place completely on the food alone. I ordered the orange chicken lunch special with fried rice for $6.75 And an appetizer sampler. First of all the "chicken" was heavily battered. upon further investigation ( me taking apart the breading ) i realized that the chicken is not breaded in house. Its the cheapest mechanically separated frozen garbage ive ever seen. This meal was worse then the chinese food station at the palace station buffet. With an overly sweet sauce dedicated to hiding the "flavor" of this so called version of meat. I was truly disappointed. I envision an owner that cares more about food cost percentages then he does about the quality of the food. Batter your own chicken! Chicken is cheap. Very disappointed! Will never visit this establishment again

I'm really picky with a place that mixes Chinese with Thai. Their pad thai doesn't cut it for me, but their Pad See Ew is as legit as the best Thai places. Therefore I like this place. You might have to do some hit or miss tests before you find what suits you.

Not impressed. I had the wor won ton soup and shrimp fried rice. Both had way too many onions.  Besides the taste of onion, the fried rice didn't really have much flavor. This was my first time here. I heard a lot of good things. And, most of the comments on Yelp were positive. The place was crowded with both people sitting and eating as well as people getting takeout. Service was good.  I'll try it again and see what happens.

We needed a fast dinner so we got delivery from this place.  I got the Laad Naa Seafood Combo (pan fried wide noodles with Chinese broccoli in brown gravy with seafood) for $13.

The entree was rather large (bigger portion than I expected) and came in one of those black microwavable dish.  

Nice rich gravy, nice load of seafood, great taste. Definitely would order form here again the next time I'm in Vegas although some of my friends didn't like their entrees.

I wasn't feelin' Thai food but after a weekend in Vegas, the one dollar sign was what attracted me most.

We had a group of 11 and the restaurant was able to seat all of us at one huge, round table.  We decided to order separately (instead of family style) and I shared with two others.  Between us three, we ordered:

-Tom Yum Soup (with Chicken): I specifically ordered "spicy", on a scale of 1-10....10!  It turned out, this Thai joint ain't no joke.  They really hit you with the hotness!  The spiciness I was fine with...but it was too overpowering and left the soup flavorless.  Next time, I'd probably order a 7.  I definitely recommend the Tom Yum Soup here because they give you an abundance of meat and mushrooms!
-Pad See Ew (with Shrimp):  was decent, but they give you so much shrimp and it's such a good price that you can't not order this.

Our leftovers hopped on the car ride back to San Diego with us and we had it for a delicious dinner.  Two meals for the price of one?  I like.  Great tasting leftovers?  I love!

If you order papaya salad, watch out - it's VERY spicy hot, and they'd only tell you that there are 2 choices - mild and spicy.  We ordered "mild" which was sooooooo spicy hot that it brought tears to my eyes (plse note I can take spicy very well). I talked to the server, who then said "oh, you should have ordered a non-spicy one". And refused to take it back.

So they expect the customers to do their job???? What the heck are the customers supposed to know that they offer a non-spicy, in addition to "mild", and "spicy"???
The POOREST customer service we have ever seen!

Eat here at your own risk!

When you want that authentic Chinese & Thai food, there's no place in Vegas (well maybe a few) that can top this one. Excellent food, large selection on their menu and the service is excellent, see my pictures, that speaks louder than words!
Terrible service. You will wait forever. Half of staff will avoid eye contact. Some of them quite rude and need good training from someone who really know "customer service" badly.
Besides the fact they take awhile to bring your food, I love this place. Me and friends come here all the time when we're craving Chinese food. Delicious !!
The best Pa Nang Chicken Curry ive ever had!!! Off the strip, cheap, and amazing food.

This place is great! My boyfriend had just recently come back from a trip to Asia, so he was craving some thai food one night. We decided we would order from here, after reading some reviews. We ordered the pad thai, fried rice, and the BBQ pork soup. We were initially impressed because we live about 20-30 minutes from this place (depending on the traffic) and they delivered with no problem! When the food came, we were even more impressed. The rice, soup, and pad thai were delicious and came in very generous portions. The BBQ pork soup was available at any spiciness you desired, on a scale of 1-10. We love spicy food, but we were nervous to go too spicy, so we ordered a 4. Well.... a 4 is HOT, very very HOT... but delicious! the flavor was great, but I would definitely recommend not going too high with the spiciness!

You know that place youre looking for in Vegas that reminds you of home? This is it! Ive never had anything bad, they deliver almost anywhere in Vegas it seems, and pricing is pretty reasonable for the amount of food you get. The chicken fried rice is my favorite!  I recommend this to everyone who asks.
Favourite Thai place in Vegas!

Food is inconsistent. Staff is rude on the phone. Food comes cold so we called to speak with the manager and the lady talks back to us. And we get put on hold for another 20 min. Then the manager actually asks if we want another one. Really?? Um, yes that would help. Then we wait another 30 min. Rediculous!!

It was a long evening and a few of us were starving! We were very glad that this place has late hours and there were SO MANY items to choose from on the menu. The best part was that the tom ka soup came flaming so it was kept warm while we were eating. Service was fast, portions were huge - the deliciousness went on for another meal!

My Fiance and I were looking for a Christmas Story style Chinese Restaurant for our Christmas dinner. Kung Fu delivered with truely authentic Asian delicacies and personnel.  If we had asked them to sing a Christmas Carol or chop the head off of a duck at our table I bet they would have. 

We knew we were at a great Asian restaurant when we looked around and noticed we were the only two non Asian people in the place. A few others came in later but knowing their own culture embraces the restaurant got us excited.

We weren't disappointed. All four dishes had wonderful flavors and aromas. They tasted very fresh and flavorful. The portion sizes were considerable so trust me you will be taking some home.

Parking did stink but if you can find a spot you won't be disappointed having to park down the block and walking a block or two.
They weren't very good 1-1/2yrs ago when I visited Vegas and ate there but maybe better now.

Needed delivered food due to a knee injury and was looking for a soup high in collagen so my first thought was something Asian. A cab driver had just recommended this place 3 days before. They have Beef Tendon Soup so I knew that would be perfect (I'd never had it). When I saw online ordering- whoohoo! No language/accent barriers with ordering . I also got Jumbo Shrimp Curry and Tom Yum Mixed Seafood Soup, and my daughter got Orange chicken and egg roll. What a great meal and the delivery time was fast. It exceeded  my expectations and I absolutely loved the curry, and the soup was also very good. We'll definitely be repeat customers.

Located in Chinatown in Las Vegas in a little strip mall. My family always makes a stop here on our annual Christmas Vegas trip before we feast on buffets after buffets. The food is okay.. they have a lot of options for family style. We always order well over 10 dishes since we come in a big group, which gives us a lot of variety. Some items worth trying are the beef salad, chicken larb, spicy cat fish, and minced chicken.

We went to our favorite restaurant in China town in honor of the Chinese New Year celebrations going on downtown over the weekend. I have to admit, I was disappointed that there wasn't a special offered or some type of unique meal for the occasion. But none the less, we all decided to try something different than our "norm" on this trip and it was Tom Yum Soup with Shrimp - we've always seen and admired it at other people's tables, so decided to give it a try. On the scale of spice, we asked for medium. I'm not much of a spicy person - medium turned out to be way too much for both my mother and I. In fact, my sister, who loves spice, tried it and it was way too much for her. It ended up ruining our dinner this night. My lips were numb from my small sampling of it and I couldn't taste anything more the rest of the night.

We were surprised that it wasn't crowded when we arrived, however, by the time we left almost every table was filled. Although I've given the restaurant four stars, this night didn't really deserve a one star. It took 30 minutes for someone to take our order. Others arrived after us, received their food before us and were on their way out the door as we were finally being served our main course. For me - this is an automatic negative review for me unless circumstances occurred causing the delay. But this was before the place got really busy. It took another 30 minutes after we were done to have our table cleared and ask for the bill. And another 15-20 minutes after receiving the bill to flag someone down to take our payment. I think we only saw our waiter once the entire night. The rest of the servers were people we had to flag down for one reason or another. 

Although the soup ended up ruining the rest of the meal, I can tell you the food there has always been wonderful! Appetizers of Crab Rangoon, Calamari, Wings (really good), Satay and combo platters have always been tasty. We make it a must to have at least one appetizer each time we go. The Pad Thai is really good - they even give you a choice of the type of noodles to have with it. Mongolian Beef is awesome! So is the Ginger and Pepper Pork/Chicken or Beef (we've had one of each). Egg Fu Young (whichever type you have) is moist, delicious and so flavorful. Overall - we really love the restaurant. Just wasn't at its best this past Saturday evening.

If I could give them -10 stars I would.
We arrived at 2:35pm order from the happy hour(it's until 3pm) menu on 2:40, at 3:05 the server came back says that he can't serve lunch spacial anymore-AFTER 30 min that we are waiting!!!!!!thats their new trick!

So we order from the regular menu,the food came dry and I found 2 hairs in my Mongolian beef+it was so chewy like a rubber.
I used to come here a lot and that was my first time after 9 months. This place change and become with tricky services,low quality of food and not clean at all. 
Better for the health dep to test this place soon as they can!!

Best thai food ever!!! OMG....ive been craving this place ever since I left!  Pad Thai, Pad See-Ew, Garlic Pepper Pork, Fried Rice, everything is amazing!!!  Service is not so great, but that disappears when you taste their food!  I will definitely return here every time i come back to vegas!!! :D

This is a great place to have your quick fix of Thai and Chinese food! It's in Chinatown off of Valley View facing the 4 way stoplights. I went with my good gf and we had a quick lunch break to chat and enjoy good cheap eats! This was the lunch time and considering it being the peak time where people from office or casinos have their lunch break most restaurants were not open? It was odd so we knew that Kung Fu had never let us down and was great to eat. We had the lunch specials where you can have a soup, egg roll and chicken wing with steam or fried rice and an entree of your choice. The entree was either Chinese or Thai to choose from. And the order was quick and fast. There were several patrons there on their lunch break too and looked like they were having the lunch special too?! It's only $7.25 and anything other than the lunch special depending on the entree should be around $7 and up. They also deliver! That's an added Plus when you can't get out of the office and or job. Super recommend!

This place has THE best Thai food in Nevada and California!  Everything here is done just to my liking.  The chefs just must be trained well.  My favorites:  pad thai with prawns; ong choy; minced chicken with garlic and basil (it's called mint, I think, but it's basil); Tom Yum soup; green papaya salad (though I like to order it with less sauce and salt, sometimes it's too saucy and salty).  This family-owned restaurant is run by a nice family and Mrs. Wang always says hi to me when she sees me.  I sure am missing this place because I haven't found a Thai place I like in the Bay Area yet.

I guess if you have a Thai craving in LV, this would be the place to go. 

They're actually a mixture of Thai, Chinese and Laos.

I dined here back in January and I can't really remember anything exceptional about this place except I enjoyed the papaya salad.

Its your typical Chinese/Thai food restaurant. It's better as family style rather than individual meals, so sharing is caring folks!

I'm sure we will be back whenever we hit Vegas up and we're not at the buffet. LOL.

Cant deny food is amazing service is horrible!  Always a wait even when slow n called in they'll say 15 when really 30 for to go takes forever for someone to acknowledge but price is good and food I'd great when correct

There was a little mom and pop Thai restaurant in my hometown of Houston that had the absolute best Pad Thai Chicken. They closed a couple of years ago and I have been on the hunt ever since for that same experience. I have found it here! And when I ask for extra spicy they never disappoint. A good compliment is the Hot and Sour Tofu soup. I have tried a couple of other dishes as has my wife and they are all good. A must if you love Thai food.

Food looks nothing like the pictures online. My zucchini was watery, and the breading was terrible. I asked for marinara with it. I didn't get that. The general tso chicken is not saucy and tastes like plain chicken. Again, these two dishes look absolutely nothing like the website photos. See my photos for comparison. The white rice and lo mien were good. Delivery was on time. Overall, I didn't get my marinara sauce, extra soy, or extra duck sauce that I asked for. The duck sauce is very very sweet and dark in color. I wouldn't order again.

After the high  reviews, we decided to eat at this restaurant. We were seated pretty quickly and the atmosphere seemed nice, which led us up to high expectations. After waiting for ten minutes to get our drink order taken, we were greeted by the rudest server ever. He kept getting our order wrong and had to repeat several times. Two of our plates  came out in a timely fashion, but we waited for all plates to come out so we could all eat together. Not an unreasonable request. 30 minutes of waiting for the rest of our order and our waiter hadnt even come to check on us. There had been 3 parties seated and served in the time that we were waiting. After 45 minutes of waiting for the other 4 plates, we asked the  waiter if we could just pay for our drinks because we weren't  going to pay for food we hadnt receieved. Somehow they magically had two more of our plates ready as we were standing up to walk out.  The waiter first tried to ignore our request, then hid in the kitchen. We were very calm in out request and just kept getting blown off. A lady came out of the kitchen and shook her hand at us as to dismiss us. Thats when our waiter came out with our checks for our drinks. 

We paid for our drinks and left. 

As you can imagine, we wont be returning. What a disappointment!
This is a staple lunch place. They have Thai and Chinese on the menus, though I've never had the Thai. The lunch specials are good, quick, and very price worthy.
Great food, growing up around Chinese food, I can say this is so much like home flavors. Love it.

I am definitely a fan!!! And they deliver! I'm a huge fan of places that serve white meat. The orange chicken is amazing! Pad Thai, amazing! Thank you! Can't wait to have it again this week!

Update: Just had this again, yup! Still great!  Mongolian beef was soooo good! I love places that have good quality meat. That's hard to find around this area.

I ordered a meal to be delivered at 7:00pm.
At 8:00 I called to check on the status of my meal. They said a driver was heading out with it. At 9:00 I called to check on the status of my meal, they said a driver was out with it. At 9:45 I called to check on the status of my meal, they said a driver was out with my food. 

On pressing them, they asked the driver (Who was actually at the restaurant), and then insisted several times I had signed for the food. When I sternly pressed that I had not received the meal, they had put the driver on the phone. The driver immediately described the wrong house and gave me my neighbors' address (The store owner had the right address, which was not my neighbor.)  The driver then suggested, an hour after he had delivered it, that I should go to my neighbor's house and ask for my food.  

  After having ordered here for at least five years, I would have at least hoped for a discount or a free appetizer. They charged me full price for the meal and offered to remake it and redeliver.  I think most people would have declined the charge outright.  

I hope they manage to sort out their drivers. Almost four hours for a meal is insane. Furthermore, they did not deliver the correct drink. Whatever they brought was orange and sincerely undrinkable, at least to me.

The food itself is excellent, Garlic Pepper Beef is an absolute favorite of mine and the Crab Rangoon is delicious.

Parking is a complete nightmare... 

We walked into an almost empty place, and were ignored.

After waiting for a human being to acknowledge us,
We were then seated at a filthy table. 
The top was sticky, and there was food all over the seat cushions... 
We flagged someone down, and they wiped it down.... Half @$$ed, that is. 
I say this because half of the booth still had food on it,
I love my husband, but we were sitting uncomfortably close to avoid sitting in someone else's dinner.

Their menu has 600 items...Ridiculous. 
it looked more like a Harry Potter novel then something that should have food items. 

Waited forever for a server to get us glasses of water, 
he dropped them off and then walked away, 
didn't even ask us if we wanted anything else to drink.

Tasted the water and walked out.

Won't be back.
I always order the beef with brown sauce. Very yummy! And their combination fried rice is also very yummy!!!

I hate being lied to.

The food there is good; not any better than any Thai place in town and a little worse than Komol and Lotus of Siam, but OK.

The service is sub-standard, but not glaringly so.

The wait times for food is unusually long; perhaps because they are trying to get you to drink more.

But they lie.

First off, never ever ever order order for pick up.  They will wait for you to show up to begin making it so you do not cheat them by a no show.  They will lie to you when you get there and say it "almost done" and immediately run you card, and then you will wait between 30-40 minutes for the food.

If you call and get them to promise they will make it and it will be waiting hot, they will still lie, and say they will.  And they will not.

This happened to me 4 times before I gave up on them, as they are the closest Thai place to my home and therefor a logical choice if we want a quick dinner.

Then we went to do deliveries at our home from them, as they we the only Thai place that we could find that delivered.  A guy came for several times, we paid a good tip and there were no issues, and then, out of the blue, the person answered the phone told us they they could not deliver to our area, it was "too far."  When we pointed out to them that they had delivered several times before, the person on the phone informed us categorically that they had never delivered to that area and accused us of lying.  We shrugged, figured we had someone new or crazy or what not, ordered someplace else and moved on.  A few weeks later we tried to order again, a different person answered the phone and again categorically informed us they had never delivered to the area where our home was located.

A change in policy because we were too far away . . . fine.  But it doesn't sit with me well how easy and enthusiastically they lie.

Their food ain't bad, but it is not worth putting up with their service or their lying.

Have some late night in Las Vegas yesterday.  Just a wonderful staff and excellent tasty dishes.  I ordered Beef fried rice, chow fun, tom yum, and other side dishes.  Would definitely come back here.

Delivery was fast thats the only reason for the 2 stars, food was about a 1.

Pad thai seemed like the noodles were cooked yesterday, the veggies seemed like most came from a can and what was fresh was brown and wilting, the soup seemed way to sour, like it was about to turn. What a waste of 30$$
Delicious food, great service and would definitely recommend the Mongolian Beef and Egg Fu Beef! Got pick-up and everything was project!!

They have pretty long vegetarian menu.
I lie them, very good service and food :)
Ami is very nice server.
The restaurant look expensive but is very good prices.
Thank you...

The wait to get in wasn't too bad. Once we were seated, we were quickly given water and ignored for the next twenty minutes. He waiter finally came and apologized for the wait. The drinks and food were really good. The pad Thai was great. I tried the mekhong, a Thai liquor, and liked it a lot. Their wine is vastly overpriced,  but it usually is when you go out anywhere. They let you add your own spice level at the table, which is much better than having to guess which number you would want. Overall, I would recommend this place.
After being dissatisfied with buffet asia we decided to finally try this place, best decision ! Very clean and attentive and also very quick. The food was amazing definitely going back !

1. service was quite slow for an asian place

2. flavors were dense (pad thai and pad see ew were okay. Tom Kha Coconut soup, ive had better. Combination FR and BBQ Chow Mein, i rather eat my parents)

3. water was refilled quite fast 

4. the name of the restaurant? kinda silly

5. thai dishes were better than their chinese dishes

6. menu was large enough to feed a whole country

7. lastly, a couple sitting to the right of us were singing to each other.. my group of 9 were disturbed

I write this review having only ever had their food delivered...maybe the experience is far different should you dine in.

We had delivery for the third time the other evening and it will be my last. It took three different pieces of sweet and sour chicken to find the chicken! Sesame chicken was not trimmed correctly so small bones/tissue completely ruined it. Thai soup only so-so and the fried rice barley passable. Other dishes in the past have also fallen short.

Thai food for delivery not worth it with so many other options in town and Chinese food consistently below par. Really wanted to like this place as the are reasonably priced and delivery is always quick but alas I cannot.

Sorry Kung Fu Plaza.

QUICK : INEXPENSIVE : GOOD PORTIONS

i've eaten at kung fu's on several occasions, usually with the bf's family cuz they enjoy the asian style restaurants more so than the vegas buffets. 
kung fu's offers a vegetarian menu which is convenient for those non meat eaters. and for those who like it spicy, there's a range of spiciness from nothing to flaming hot. i like kick to my food and mild was good. if you like it hella spicy then go for it, but they aren't jokin' around. 
the waiters are really friendly, helpful when ordering and give feed back about dishes/portions if you ask. 
theres a lunch time menu... seems like a good bargain, but the individual plates are good too, especially if you wanna go family style. there's not a lot of people on a normal basis, but there is a good crowd.

suggestions:
tom yum soup (vegetarian and non-vegetarian) - both great
duck soup - good size for a 1 person meal
papaya salad (vegetarian/mild) - good kick, they do give more cabbage than i would like (i HATE cabbage)
vegetarian egg rolls - ok, comes with rice and i didnt really enjoy their version of sweet and sour sauce (kinda oily texture to it)
pad see ewe - nothing special, same as any other place

i can't recall the other things that was ordered cuz everyone pretty much picks like 5 dishes each and we all share... yes we are pigs... 

for 2 people we spent $40, BUT we had left overs for another meal
for 20 people we spent well over several hundered $$$$$ but like i said, we are OINKERS....

Enjoyed the Mongolian Beef based on a friends recommendation and was not disappointed.  Service was so outstanding the water in our glasses appeared full the whole meal.  Business has been around for 42 years and now I know why.  The owner greeted us halfway thru the meal and couldn't believe it was my first time to visit her establishment.  She informed me all dishes are made to order with an option on every dish of 1 to 10 on how spicy you like it.  You can definitely taste the difference in the pride and quality of the food and service.  Will be back again!!
Bad service ...I placed a order they gave it to a bigger party ....the manager said sorry ....I order once more from them so it happen again .....

This was me and my boyfriends first time eating here! I tried Thai food and he stuck to Chinese. I ordered Pork Thai and broccoli (not the actually name) and it was great. The house's sauce was a bit sweet, and it kind of over powered the dish; that's why I give this review a 4/5. There was just too much sauce!

Overall, the food was delicious and we'll probably be back! Thank you!
The food is absolutely amazing ! The service is just as great. Attentive and friendly staff .

Kung Fu has one of the best lunch specials in Vegas. For $5.95 you get soup, an entree with steamed or fried rice, an egg roll and a fried chicken wing from 11-3pm.

The rest of the menu is very exhaustive including Thai and Chinese dishes. The hot pots of soup are intense and delicious, better for parties of 3 or more.

The food is rich and flavorful and none of the staff speaks much English*, which means the cook are Thai and know what they're doing.

*In an effort to not sound offensive, if you want people to speak perfect English get some generic food from Panda Express.

I was surprised to see all the negative reviews here! My husband and I dined here after we discovered Lotus of Siam was closed between 2:30 and 5:30pm. We ordered Crab Rangoon/Wontons, Mongolian Beef and Shrimp Pad Thai between the two of us. They also serve a small selection of alcoholic beverages.

Our food was amazing! And the service was fast. I did have to point out to our waiter which white wine I wanted on the menu so maybe communicating your food order over the phone could be tricky. But the fact that they offer online ordering should resolve this problem. AND, do you want authentic or not?! The hostess and our waiter were very pleasant and professional. 

Lastly, we saved a lot of money getting off the strip. We will definitely return!

First time and last experience here. We ordered Thai fried rice and Pad Thai. The fried rice was oily and lacking flavor. Pad Thai was nothing but peppers and bland. I've had better Thai food on my side of town, I.e. Pin Kaow and Thai House. Even Panda fried rice than this place. Sorry Panda. 
Poor customer service as well. 
Just because it's a great location with guaranteed traffic doesn't give you the right to produce mediocre food.

Been going here for years. Great authentic Thai food! My favorite dish to order here is Pad Thai, they use slightly thinner noodles....what a difference!  If you like Thai food then go here! Only downside to this place is sometimes you receive less than stellar service, but that doesn't stop me from going.

Our very asian looking dealer at the Rio Casino told us to come here for good thai food. I thought, GREAT! A local recommending a good thai restaurant - it MUST be good. she also recommended the stuffed fried chicken wings which also sounded bomb.

GPSed this place and went with 4 other people. I first looked for the chicken wings under appetizer and found it: Stuffed fried chicken wings (2). WHAT THE HELL. 8.95 for 2 wings? Whatever, we ordered it anyway since the dealer recommended it. I ordered the laad na with beef (flat noodles topped with gravy sauce with beef), my bf ordered the pad thai with chicken, my other 2 friends ordered pad see ew with chicken, and the other ordered roast duck over fried rice.

First of all, let me just say, it took almost half an hr just for the waitress to come to our table to get our order. Second, it took another 45 min for the food to come. The thai ice tea came out pretty quick though and was pretty tasty.

The stuffed fried chicken wings came out first. Man, that was a small portion. We all took 1/5 of the wing and it was mediocre.

30 min later,  My laad na was finally came and was DISGUSTING. I dont think ive ever had nastier laad na than this place. It was bland, the noodles were not pan fried at all, and the beef was dry and overcooked. My bf's pad thai was soso. The pad see ews came with 90% noodles, 5% veg, and 5% chicken. The duck fried rice looked disgusting also. I think the only tasty item in this restaurant is their thai ice tea.

-2 for food, - 2 for service, and +1 for thai ice tea.

Came here around 9 and it was sorta empty on a Saturday night or maybe people were celebrating chinese new year?

Anyways, service was slow when there was only 4 tables that were being served. 

Ordered the medium tom yum soup with big flat noodles ( loved it!!!!)

Beef fried rice- the beef taste burnt but the fried rice was good.

Last- tofu with basil.  Soggy and was drenched in too much garlic sauce!  (not that great!)

I've been here 3x and the more I come here, the worst the food gets!

It's better to come here for the soup only!

I have to come here every time I visit Vegas. It's off the strip, so if you're feeling lazy, they deliver right to your hotel! (with a $5 charge which is so worth it if you're hungover/tired/etc). They take about 45 minutes to an hour.

I always get the Tom Yum Shrimp. NO MATTER WHAT. and you can get the level of spice. I am a huge spicy food fan so I always get 7/10. 

The restaurant has many different dishes to choose from- thai and chinese. So you will get your fix if you're craving something savory. 

And of course you can't forget the fortune cookies they generously pack :)

If you're in Vegas for any length of time and you're looking to order in!  I would highly recommend this venue to anyone!  The food is ome of the most consistent that I've ever had and the service is second to none!

I've never dined in, but each time that I've ordered takeout it's been nothing less than outstanding

enjoy!

Awful service, poor hospitality, poor managment, extremely  poor quality of food. Portions sizes of meat not even enough to satisfy a rat. Communication skills were horrible. Do not go to this place definitely do not recommend.

This is one the best restaurants ever!!! No only is the food good but the service is great! Staff is very polite and restaurant is very nice and clean! My favorite dish is the orange chicken! I definitely recommend this place to everyone!!!!

After driving around in search of a Chinese restaurant, we decided on this place. This place is hood!! It's extra ghetto inside with the worst service ever. I really can't complain though when the dishes are soo cheap. The food just wasn't good. In fact, I would say it's pretty disgusting. I ordered a broccoli and chicken dish, and the chicken wasn't fresh at all. I was actually scared to eat the meat!! Everything inside was sticky, dusty and dirty. They definitely need a makeover with the decor, food and service.
Food is yummy. Coconut soup is my go to. Great portions. Decent prices. I LOVE their Thai tea. Cool place to eat with friends or a date :)

Huge menu selection of Thai and Chinese food. This place was busy for 9p and continued to be busy until we left around 10:15p. The staff was extremely friendly and polite! I had their Chicken Satay. This was very filling and came with a small cucumber  salad. They had vegetation options for my friends. These dishes were excellent! I wanted dessert but it was getting late for the kids in our party! This place is super easy to find: on the corner of Spring Mountain and Valley View!

I dunno, maybe I didn't order the right thing. The vegetarian selection had the standard dishes but the dish that caught my eye was the Mongolian tofu. We also ordered the fried spring rolls, papaya salad and a glass noodle soup.

The Mongolian tofu dish was deep friend tofu cubes which I normally LOVE, but it was soggy and oily. The 'mixed veggies'  with it were very sparse. The sauce was so-so.

The spring rolls and papaya salad were decent... no better than other places.

The veggie glass noddle soup was a load of noodles in a tasteless broth with lacking veggies.

P.S. I thought about a return visit to try other dishes but I would much rather go to Komols, Ping Pong, Hue Thai or Veggie Delight. Always good.

Adequate service, they could have tried to be at least more attentive. I even asked for those 4 chili sauces from one of the waiters and I still didn't even get it when my table and I finished our food. And we had to seat ourselves in because they weren't even paying attention to is near the entrance. But I must say, I've tried Thai restaurants from both California and Nevada and this place has good food, the dishes here are so perfectly seasoned, there is no too sweet, too plain, or too salty or not enough saltiness. Probably coming back again when I visit Las Vegas.

We just moved away from Las Vegas and if there was one restaurant we could take with us it would have been Kung Fu, no doubt. We're having at the moment Kung Fu relapses! This place was the best and I mean THE VERY BEST!! When it came to Thai food, there was one other place we enjoyed but we always went to Kung Fu though instead. As for Chinese and you could say Thai food  as well that when we left Kung Fu we would never have the aftermath horror of like that horrible feeling in our stomachs when the food is laced, injected, bathed or drowned in MSG and it's as if you ate something good but when it hits your stomach it metamorphisizes into a few bricks. We were NEVER, NOT ONCE disappointed with the food as well the great service we received here, the food always seemed fresh, no MSG aftermath horrors and the waiters were always polite and kind. Such an impeccable place that we will definitely miss. No wonder they've been open for so long, it shows and you can tell by how delicious the food is, we will not forget this place.

The name doesn't sound like a good/authentic Thai place. But I have to admit this place served the best Thai I had ever had. I had tried Thai in many places such as Toronto, London (UK), Malaysia, Hong Kong, Singapore - this is by far the best Thai!! We ordered Mango salad, Tom Yum Soup and Pineapple Fried Rice. We ended up finishing everything on the table! I will go back to Vegas one day just for this restaurant!

We ordered carryout for a party of 6. After waiting 45 minutes for delivery it still hadn't arrived and after 30 more minutes and numerous calls to the restaurant and driver our food finally arrived. The food was phenomenal but it would've been nice to be compensated for the wait time or at least them called us to say sorry driver was lost instead of us having to find out what the hold up was. If our food was delivered timely we would've given 5 stars. It was that good!

Food a solid 4 stars, leaning higher.  Excellent tom yum seafood, fried chicken wings, and a plethora of vegetarian entrees with great variety.  Service a bit slack, and DANGER! the bar is *terrible* (we were served a watery margarita and an undrinkable bloody mary) so stick to bottled beer!

Family style ordering and a vast menu of Chinese, Thai, and vegetarian dishes - great for families/bigger groups!  Though I did notice that the restaurant was packed with a diverse crowd of non-Asians.  Therefore, I have mixed feelings about this place because food is good, but being in the heart of Chinatown; I'm certain there are better options/hidden gems around the same price range. 

We didn't love the broth of the vegetarian Tom Yum Kha soup bc it lacked coconut milk. From the reviews, it seems like the non-vegetarian version is the way to go.  Our main dishes were much better, getting usuals like Pad Thai, Chinese Cabbage, and Beef & Broccoli.  Spice levels range from 1-10.

Ps. bathroom lines can get as bad as a theme park wait because there is only one bathroom per gender.

My husband isn't the type who likes to try new places, but he has been a lot more open to the idea lately. I have been coming to Kung Fu Thai & Chinese Restaurant for years and love it, so I convinced my husband to try it out. He is a fan now!! Their Mongolian Beef is the best in town and their service is great. The prices are affordable and the food gets to the table within minutes of ordering.

I used to live within walking distance to this place, so it was one of my go to places! For Chinese though, not so much Thai with one of my favorite Thai places across the street. Awesome prices, especially for lunch, and decent food. It's not at the Joyful level in terms of quality but Kung Fu with definitely 'get er done!'

This absolute &@"-&!?&@ of a restaurant decided it would be smart to close the restrooms for over 20minutes while patrons waited to use the restroom during their evening dining hours. I insisted after 20 minutes to use it. They finally let me use it and what's funny is that nothing was unclean and also after making a slight scene one of their workers suddenly decided to roll a mop bucket toward the restrooms at that time.  Unsure what all that was about it but I suggest any and all of Vegas and visitors to never patronize this place.
First timer. It was good compared to China a go go. Fresh food but pricey for the portions. Loved the Chicken Laarb, Tom yum soup and definitely recommend the sweet n sour pork!

The fam & I just checked in to our condo on the strip tired from the very hot drive from L.A.  This was the only place I could find on the book that deliver Chinese food where we are so I took my chances.  I ordered satay chicken, shrimp pad thai, mongolian beef, shrimp Thai fried rice, whole deep fried catfish, chicken panang, papaya salad and steamed rice ( I know it sounds a lot, but I also have the parents w/us), bill came up to $72.  The satay had a good flavor and not dry like some places.  Their menu said the shrimp pad thai and shrimp fried rice comes with plump shrimp ...what we got in these dishes looked very small and not as advertised---very disappointing.  The flavors were good though but they shouldn't have underlined "plump shrimp".  The cat fish was very good and almost made up for the shrimp.  The papaya salad had a good flavor but I would have liked the papaya shredded thinner.  Everything else was so-so, I've had better.  My dad liked it for the spiciness.

This is a nice restaurant. My family always come here for Thai food whenever we are in vegas. 

From all the times we have came here, this place is amazing. Its Thai food is very similar to actual Thai food. I can't comment on chinese food though.

My only complaint is that they put one dish down at a time instead of putting down all the dishes at the same time.

Ordered from this place based on recommendation from the front desk at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club. Delivery charge was only $4.00 which beats taking a cab ride to and from the hotel.  We looked at the website and ordered most of the favorites.  We liked the Tom Kha soup, Fried Chicken WIngs and the Chicken Chowmein.  They all tasted good and authentic. We didn't care for the Wonton soup, Mongolian Beef, Eggrolls or Pad Thai.  The Pad Thai was very average and noodles were clumped up together. The Steamed Vegatables with dipping sauce was ok and there was about 8 different vegetables in it.  I would definitely order from here again picking the right dishes.

This restaurant was recommended by a Vietnamese gal who worked in a nail salon...we wanted Chinese food so we tried it.  The food was great, service very good and a very ethnic feel to it...many Asians eating there so we felt that was a good recommendation too.  It was great and we'll go back.

I go here around three times a year and the service and food are always good and at a decent price.
I always have the curry, the tofu with it is chewy and soft, and the rice is quite nice and the vegetables that go along with it are very complimentary.
All around the restaurant are tiny sculptures and some paintings, which are a bit ornate for a place like this, and are fun to look at.

Very accommodating! Our daughter made reservations for her friends for Homecoming and they had no problems with all 20 kids(plus all the driving parents!)  being at the restaurant. The food was good. We got steamed potstickers (will do fried next time) Mongolian beef (oh my gosh the sauce is awesome!) and cashew chicken (just sweet enough to be perfect!). Service was great for a Saturday night with an almost full house! Our waitress was quite attentive and we didn't ever have to worry about refills. Prices were reasonable for the area. We will be back!

One of our favorite places to eat in Las Vegas, hands down. It's bit of a drive from where we live, but worth the trip every time. I haven't ordered a dish here that I didn't like. 

The menu is massive and little overwhelming if you don't know what you want to eat. They offer both Chinese and Thai dishes. My husband and I always have a dilemma when ordering because we want to try new things but also want to order the dishes we love. Hubby always orders way too much food to insure he gets a great lunch the next day.

Recommended dishes: 
Pa-nang Chicken- thick curry with coconut milk
Tom Kha Chicken - Lemongrass soup with coconut milk
Pad See Ew - Wide rice noodles in a garlic sauce
Mongolian Beef- you all know what this is...
Love it! my fav is the Thai beef salad.......yum. Anything you order is delish.

Please note this review is only for delivery - I've never eaten at the actual restaurant.

Tough to review this place on just a * rating, so let me explain:

1) Chinese dishes are Thai-style, so extremely sweet.
2) Thai food is decent enough to satisfy my fix, but not a lot of variety.
3) Ingredients (esp. vegetables) seem fresh / good quality. Seafood combo dishes mostly imitation, however.
4) Portion size varies anywhere from meh to very good; meat ratios vary even more wildly.
5) Online ordering system is fantastic for convenience.
6) They deliver fast and have never gotten the order wrong, and reliable delivery is a rarity in Vegas.

Ya, probably averages out somewhere a bit above a 3*, but I think rounding up to 4* is a bit too generous especially since I avoid the Chinese food. Despite any negatives, the Thai food is flavored right and that's what counts. With the convenient ordering and reliable delivery, still good enough to make the rotation for our office's lunch delivery.

Second time here, food came out very fast on a Saturday afternoon lunch time, pretty dang tasty overall, had a Pa-nang curry, pineapple fried rice, Mongolian beef, chicken pad Thai. We ordered everything spicy, yet still wanted more heat! If you like your Thai dishes spicy, order it at an 11 (out of 10). Maybe you'll get lucky and get that heat we missed out on.

I will start saying the restaurant is clean. We were seated right away and our server was prompt to come to our table.. Order was right on point delicious& fresh. The owner even step out from the kitchen and came to our table to greet us. While we waited for our food she share how long her restaurant had been in business. Interesting lady. Overall I highly recommend this place whenever your in town. Hubby and I like to expire the local restaurant whenever we are in town.  

Place got super busy right before we finish our food

First timer here and I have to say I am pleasantly surprised! We ordered chicken pad see ew and the sweet green curry with chicken. 

The pad see ew was so good, I really liked how some of the noodles had a crunch to them because they were stir fried and not over cooked. And the curry was pretty amazing. Don't order if you can't take spice because the order comes precooked with spices so I ordered little to no spice and it had a kick to it but I didn't mind, still tasted awesome. 

At first the dishes looked so plain and unattractive, not like other Thai restaurants but once I tried the food I was blown away! 

I guess that's how you know a restaurants Chefs and ingredients are amazing, when the dishes look so plain but have amazing flavor! Not drenched in typical sauce packets like Thai house or lucky Thai. I'm really happy I tried this place out.

Their food was absolutely delicious. The only reason i didn't give the 5th star was that it TOOK OVER AN HOUR TO DELIVER and we are about 10 minutes away. I ordered the Bean Sprouts and Jumbo Shrimp with jasmine rice and my coworker ordered the lunch special Orange Chicken and Fried rice. No complaints here and i will order again.

One of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to.  Every time we're in town, we make sure to eat here at least once.  We've even ordered to go on our ride back to Cali a couple of times.
This is what we usually order and have never been disappointed:

Papaya salad w/ salted crab - THE BEST
Tom Yum Goong
Pad Se Ew seafood
Beef noodle soup
House fried rice

Can't wait to go back in April!

This is our second trip to Las Vegas in the last two weeks, and our second trip to to the restaurant. We were actually looking forward to coming back here this week when we found out we had to make a return trip up here so soon. The Thai food here is absolutely wonderful! The staff is kind and the food is served pretty quickly and is just so satisfying. I'm sure this will be a regular stop for us every time we are in town.

I'm visiting Vegas for a convention. Unfortunately, my hotel is off the strip and with 104 degree temperatures the last thing I wanted to do was go back out in the heat for food. Did an Internet search for places that deliver. A million pizza joints, but I wanted something different. Came across some good reviews for Kung Fu so I placed an online order.

About two minutes after the order was placed, a gentleman called from Kung Fu to verify some of the things on my order. Whhaaaaat? A restaurant that doesn't just guess but actually follows up with the customer? Amazing! He told me the food would be delivered in an hour but it was more like 30-45 minutes.

And it was sooooo good. I was craving egg drop soup and theirs didn't disappoint. I had also ordered the chicken with chili and mint over rice and received a HUGE portion for the price. Got a large drink too. Cost for everything plus delivery and tip was only about $22, making it more than worth it. Not to mention the awesomeness of having it delivered to my hotel.

Definitely will be keeping this one on my list for future trips to the area. It's easy to understand why they've been open so long!

Pretty good food at decent prices and relatively large portions. Been to Kung Fu several times and would definitely go back. Go give this place a try it isn't the best but it is pretty good and cheap.

Just had the lunch special good price, nice portion but zero flavor,  the moo goo just tastes like nothing really.  Fried rice zero flavor , everything was cooked but seems like the salt was forgotten.  Not sure why this is a go to spot for a lot of people. Will give it another try but right now food has like blah.

Usually get good service, but not all the time. I sat there 15 minutes today at lunch with my wife and watched 3 tables come in after us, and all order. Meanwhile we sat there with water and no menu's, and no orders taken from us (drinks or food). We had enough after table 4 came in and ordered. We just left, having only tried the water (and still no one noticed us)! There was only 5-7 tables in the whole place at the time!
The best Thai and Chinese food in las vegas. I recommend to all ages and good pricing.
Tom Yum was amazing, everything else seemed to be a little too sweet. Other then it's a really quite place to go eat.
Worst shrimp egg fu young ever. No egg just chopped celery with miniature shrimp. Fried noodle were sweet and oily never again
We had the Shrimp Egg Foo Young, Shrimp Pad Thai and Laarb Chicken.  All were excellent.

We were a party of 6 and having just been to Chinatown in SF, I was disappointed.  The service was just about as bad as it gets - with items coming out and varied times and some of the dishes were downright skimpy.  It wasn't bad or great - was just okay.

I have gone to this Thai restaurant on almost everyone of my Vegas trips, which have been plenty. You have not had Thai pho until you've had it here. Very authentic. They never disappoint me on any of the dishes I've ordered. This last time I was there I didnt see my normal waiter, I'm not sure whether it's changed hands or not. I ordered to go and the food was a little different, still good tough, plus I didnt see the usual waiter in there that remembers me the 2-3 trips a year that I'm there. Regardless still one of my fav Thai restaurants.
40mins later and still waiting for my order! My first time here and I'm never coming back..

This place is awesome ! The servers get to you quickly, they're always so friendly and helpful. If you've never been here for sure try the Tom Yum soup with shrimp, it has me hooked ! I've tried several different items on the menu and it's all been so tasty. The portioning is very good for the price. One item can easily be split between 2 people. Definitely recommend it

We wanted to get rid of all the late night alcohol taste now so we can start fresh and drink some more later =). What can cleanse your palate better than a steamy bowl of spicy tom yum soup? Our Thai friend told us about this place and we were surprised how good the food was. My second time eating here and the business name still throws me off. Pretty authentic Thai dishes, which reminds me of a few spots in Thai Town, Krung Tedd and Hollywood Thai. 

The waiter let us know up front that it's easier for them to add additional spicy than to remove it. We understand dude, haha, we can handle it.

Favorite:
Tom Yum Soup - chicken or shrimp
Crispy Pork with Basil and Chili
Papaya Salad

Food - 4.5 stars
Service - 4 stars: we had to flag someone down for more rice then later for our check.
Parking - the parking lot stretches along Spring Mtn
Restroom - 3 stars
Wait - came during lunch time and were seated right away

The food is sooooooo good, however their service isn't. Be prepared to wait... For a long time for any help. Lunch specials are only on weekdays. The chop chicken chili is my favorite, spicy level 8... Anything below isn't very spicy. The Mongolian beef spicy level 8 is also really good, as well as their Thai Teas. For quality of food though and variety this place is one of the best.

As any other Thai or Chinese restaurant , the food is flavorful and aromatic with exotic spices.i have to admit some of the prices are high but definitely worth it. I love the seafood fried rice has spectacular quality seafood( scallops, fishball,squid, etc) I ordered the Tom yum with jumbo shrimp which was very good!
Excellent food and service! No wait, popular spot! Great atmosphere. Thoroughly enjoyed myself and my husband loved the combination fried rice with crab.

Place wasn't really busy when we arrived on Christmas day in late afternoon so we didn't have to wait long. Food was good as ever and our server was nice and helpful as we wanted to try something we haven't had before. Was hectic when we were going to leave so took a bit to get our check and to go boxes.  Overall as good as it's always been

Horrible service, worse then a fast food joint that is slammed as f* and has a 16 year old working the window. Tell me why all they did was take our order 20 minutes after being seated, drop off the food and never come back to check on us. Don't waste your time. There's better places on spring mountain that will satisfy your Chinese or Thai food cravings

Very good lunch, service, and atmosphere. Thai food is one of my faves and this place was outstanding. Took my vegas buddy here while in town  and he was very happy with the quality and service. I'll make this a stop any time I'm in town .

I work at a casino on the strip and this is the only place my co-workers and I could find that would deliver. The food is pretty good, there's no complaint there. The only complaint that I have is when we place an order over the phone. There are two people that we've noticed who take the orders, one is male the other is female. Every time we order from the male, the orders are always correct. When we order from the female, every time, the order is incorrect. Everytime. When we've called back to have them correct the mistake, she will sit there and argue with us. We've decided not to order from them again. Too bad. They've just lost steady business.

we are giving them 1 start because that's the only option, this place is terrible, we order Kung pao shrim and they give us 5 shrimps with tons of ginger it did not taste like Kung pao at all.
my husband order pad Thai shrimp and the noodle was like anger air pasta w mini tiny shrimps. the prices are crazy we pay $50 for a really bad dinner!! don't ever order in this place

I noticed that a lot of negative reviews are about service, but I have never had that issue here. They refill our waters quite frequently, a lot better than most other restaurants. Everything that I have ever had at this restaurant has been really good. My top picks are the pad thai, pad si ew, tom yum, and the panang. I have also recently tried the Mongolian beef and that was also delicious! Kung Fu will always be one of my favorite thai and chinese go to. Most people are wary of restaurants that have three stars, but I highly recommend trying this place out. They have been open for decades, they are still here for a reason.

I was here a few days ago and I shared five dishes, and only one of the dishes disappointed me.  It was the "orange chicken".  The orange chicken was heavily battered and there was very little orange glaze on it.  So if I were you, I would avoid the orange chicken at all costs!

I live in NLV and was in the area. I figured Chinese food in Chinatown had to be good.  There was a lot of people waiting outside but when we went in to ask how long the wait was we were told a few minutes.  We got lucky because everyone else who came in after us were ignored.  We were seated about 15 minutes later then ignored.  Someone came up with menus after we were seated for about 5 minutes then no one came back.  The people around us who had been seated after us had water and their orders taken.  I finally grabbed a busboy and asked him to get me a waiter.  The waiter finally showed up and we ordered appetizers as well as dinner.  My daughter ordered soup for dinner which even though it was obvious that's all she was getting,  they brought it with the drinks then the appetizers came after about 30 minutes then our dinner almost immediately.  I had the Mongolian beef which was small but the meat was good.  I think the food would have been better if I didn't have such a bad taste in my mouth from the service - or lack thereof.

I was tired of the pages and pages of pizzeria and sub fliers when a talk with the front desk lead me to carouse the menu of Kung Fu Thai & Chinese. Relieved to get something that's a little closer to home, we ordered extra to keep in the fridge for leftovers in our hotel room.

Combo pad thai was good, on the average side, medium or so portion. I would've liked to have the option of making it spicy when ordering over the phone.

Combo chop suey: The sauce and amount was great. If the ingredients marinated in the sauce a bit more, it would've been better, but with a little hot sauce it was awesome.

Mongolian beef was also good with a darker sauce and fried wonton chips sauteed with bell peppers and onions.

Wor Wonton Soup: Probably one of the best won ton soups I've had that wasn't home made. Light, and chock full of veggies and pork and mushrooms. Yum!

One other thing...

Jumbo Thai Iced Tea: Picture a Big Gulp sized Iced Tea. @_@

Overall, good quality food at awesome quantity for an amazing price.

Been coming here since I was 5 and I am now 24 my whole family is hooked and now even my boyfriend ;) lol this place is my favorite Thai restaurant. Full of flavors and spices. Chopped chicken mint leaf spicy all the way and the chicken chow mein are my gotta haves all the time. Love love love this place!!

Service was bad, and one of the dishes, Pineapple Fried Rice, was horrible.  Their Thai BBQ chicken was on the dry side.  The flat noodles, that they use for Pad See Ew, were on the thick thick side.  

The Pineapple Fried Rice was just soggy.  It didn't even seem that it was fried because of all the water or stock they added.  It was almost to the verge of porridge territory.

I was surprised at the prices too, about $10 a dish, for the quality and quantity they serve (meaning small portion).

Their menu is extensive. They specialize in Thai, and Chinese food.

I would rather go to the strip and pay and eat Americanized Chinese food.

With a previous night of drunken debauchery in Sin City - Vegas we leave our beautiful suite at Palazzo and look for some good sober-up yet cold-weather warming food. Votes in - and THAI food it is! But where? So I remember heading out to Chinatown in a prior visit to Vegas a couple months back at Kung Fu! CHEAP, GOOD, and did I mention...GOOD!
So 15 minutes later we're there and were seated promptly. Luckily, it was already after lunchtime  so we didn't encounter any wait time. 
We all chose to order dishes and share the portions. Tom Yum (HOT - of course), Pad Thai, some beef salad, and shrimp fried rice! 
The guys were digging the food but like myself, they agreed the service was aiiiiight! Could have been better (hence the 4 stars). SO - if you're in vegas and have a hankerin' for some Thai/Chinese (good decent and reminiscent of SGV style) hit Kung Fu up! It'll make you say...."HAAAAY YA!" LOL!
Authentic Thai food. Delicious and great customer service. The place is large but get very crowded during normal lunch and dinner hour. Prepare to wait for a table but it's worth the wait.

Not enough superlatives - Best Thai food outside of Thailand.

Since our two weeks in Thailand several years ago we have constantly been sampling Thai food both at home and during our travels. This is unquestionably the best Thai food we have had in the USA. 

It was recommended by a staff member at our hotel. This plus reading TA reviews convinced me that this should be the place for our first evening's meal in Las Vegas. We ate there three of the four nights of our stay. 

I enjoyed the sweet and sour Thai style chicken so much I ordered it 3 times. We also shared beef with mixed vegetables and Pad Thai chicken.

We'll most certainly return on our next trip. It will be hard to choose an alternative restaurant as this place has set the bar so high. Our local Thai restaurant (which is fairly good) will have to suffice until next year.

Can't put zero star, too bad.. Almost 2 hours wait for our food to be delivered and we live 2 blocks away.. The food was really disgusting, wonton soup was pink (because the pork inside was pink!), rice was disgusting (how you mess you rice up!?), bbq pork was allright... So overall, i guess i won't order from them ever again... :/

Best of Vegas hands down. Service is top
Of the top and the food is even better. I found this place one time my car was broke down I was taking the bus.
I was on the corner dying of heat in the middle of July at mid day. Guy comes out with with a cup of water after noticing me sitting there rotting in the sun. I took my family over there as a result of their kindness and believe me when I tell you the food is insane ! The fried rice !!! The general  tsao chicken !!!!!!!!!!!! Everything is off the hook and straight up your just nuts if you haven't been there !!!

This place is pretty freaking good.
Totally took me by surprise.
I came for dinner and I will usually order pad see ew but since I was with a large group we decided to eat family style.
Lucky me!

We ordered:
Beef sate'
Tom yum goong
Tom kaa chicken
Mint chicken
Pork plik king
Curry catfish of some sort
Red beef curry
I was very impressed with all the above dishes.
In fact I came back the next day just to try the pad see ew, and that was also very good.
Well balanced flavors with just enough kick for this westerner to get a good idea of what they are working with.

The Thai iced tea was also prepared very well and had way too much milk just the way I like it.

The only thing that was lacking was the interior was a bit dated.
But im not here to eat the painting on the wall.
Also the service was not as attentive as I would have liked.
We had to wave down the waiter numerous times.
And lastly the food is a bit more expensive than I expected. 

But the food is very good.
